intro: Ischnosiphon gracilis subsp. gracilis, commonly known as the slender thistle, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender, erect stems covered in fine, white hairs. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are usually pink to purple in color, blooming from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped, with a rough, hairy texture and a tendency to be slightly lobed. This species is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and disturbed soils, where it thrives in full sun to partial shade.
